data.title: Fix console output for MinGW compilers.
data.body: As the title says, the console output that only displays the first letter of every message is now fixed when compiling with MinGW recent compilers.

data.title: Added snapping to 3D path handles
data.body: The 3D version of the Path node wasn't using the editor snap settings when editing a path/curve (the 2D version did) so I've now enabled this.

data.title: Can't activate plugins (macOS-only?)
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
macOS Sierra (10.12.1) - Godot-master

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I cannot activate any plugin I download or write for Godot.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1. Create an addon (plugin.gd and plugin.cfg)
1. Open Project Settings > Plugins
1. Select *Inactive* and switch it to *Active*
1. Obtain this message:
![Godot plugin error](http://i.imgur.com/9VcBc5L.png)

I'm pretty sure I'm following [the documentation right](http://docs.godotengine.org/en/latest/tutorials/making_plugins.html) too.

**UPDATE**:
Ah, wait, this is conditional behavior. It works on some; I'll check out what's wrong with this picture.

Will close this if I find a solid answer.

data.title: Update/fix Android build
data.body:
Fix wrong path for 32-bit Windows, which fixes #7084
Exclude 32-bit Windows from multi-threaded linking because it's not supported by the NDK
Remove 32-bit Linux as there is no NDK variant for it

data.title: Emit "*_changed" signal in set_*
data.body:
Add `emit_signal` in `set_*` function.
It's useful when make `reset` function in game with showing or hiding reset button.

data.title: Raycasting picking up non_ray_pickable CollisionObjects
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Archlinux 64-bit with xfce4, using godot_v2.1-stable_x11.64

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Doing raycast from script, collided with a _CollisionObject_ that had the _'ray_pickable'_ attribute set to false. That obviously shoudn't happen.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Set an object of any type, let's call it _obj1_, a little higher in the Y-axis from a _CollitionObject_ of any type, let's call it _obj2_, wich has a _CollisionShape_. Now execute this from script:
```
var obj = get_node("obj1")
var pos = obj.get_translation()
	
var spaceState = get_world().get_direct_space_state()
# Casting from ten units down the Y-axis
var castResult = spaceState.intersect_ray(pos, pos-Vector3(0, 10, 0))
	
if not castResult.empty():
	print("Collision occured")
else:
	print("No collision occured")
```
As an extra detail, the issue persists even if you delete the _CollisionShape_ from _obj2_.

**Link to minimal example project**:
https://bitbucket.org/PaoloBB4/godot-test-raycasting-error
In this example there are two objects _block1_ and _block2_, colored red and green accordingly and _block2_ is a _StaticBody_ with _'ray_pickable'_ set to false.

If collision occures the red block is translated to the point of collision and the message _"Collition occured"_ is displayed on output.
Otherwise it remains in place and the message _"No collition occured"_ is displayed on output.

Enabling the flag `javascript.options.wasm_baselinejit` to use Firefox's experimental compiler starts up faster.

Compiling per LLVM backend doesn't work yet, this is just another step.

data.title: Color from String ARGB or RGBA?
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10 64bit - Godot 2.1-stable_win64

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Creating a Color from a String reads the string as Alpha, Red, Green, Blue. While the Docs say it should be read as RGBA which, as I understand, means Alpha is the last two characters.
This may be on purpose, since Color Picker also writes colors this way. Nevertheless it's weird that Color(0x000000FF) and Color("000000FF") create two different colors.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Just create a Color("000000FF") and a Color(0x000000FF) and check their Blue and Alpha values.

data.title: setget functions are called for self assignment
data.body:
I don't know if this is the intended behavior or not (if it is, sorry, just close this issue), but this clearly should not be allowed!

Let us say, 
1) I want a variable `foo` to have a value of 1 by default, 
2) and it changes its value when user interacts in someway (let us say input). 
3) After the user is done, the value of `foo` must have the value of 1 again.

What happens here is, the functions associated with `setget` are called every time the value is set to 1 when it is already 1, it should be called once (the first time) when the original value is different. This is somewhat killing the performance for me, I know I can do this:
```
if (new_value == old_value):
   return
```
But this should be done automatically.

data.title: Write a specification for .tscn
data.body:
On godotengine/collada-exporter#43 recently but in other issues as well the role of Collada in the Godot pipeline was discussed, and some people (like @reduz) expressed the possibility that .tscn is used directly instead of Collada, considering Blender supports PBR in the Cycles renderer, which is incompatible with the Blender Internal renderer which is used for exporting right now (like @set-killer pointed out).

I think that a better 3D pipeline is necessary for Godot 3.0 to become popular as a 3D engine. Not saying Collada support should be dropped but just looking at some facts:

1. The latest version of Collada was released in August 2008
2. Collada is (was?) developed by a committee of big names like Sony, so contributing to it is not easy
3. Collada is not that popular, even among FLOSS game engines
4. The Blender devs haven't really said if they want to merge BCE or not, but from what I've understood they are on the fence about it because it doesn't have an importer

Exporting to .tscn might be a better idea but the problem is that it is not really an open standard, since there is no formal specification out there and it's directly tied to Godot's implementation, while Collada is, so data between other engines and 3D programs can easily be exchanged (ideally).

So I propose a specification for .tscn is written, so that all coders who wish to do so can easily implement .tscn importers and exporters without having to crawl into Godot's source.

It would be bad if Godot's excellent 3D capabilities were held back by a third-party format, and it would be even worse if proprietary formats like FBX were adopted, so I say that since .tscn already exists and that it is fine-tuned for being used with Godot, some work should be done to make sure a 3D pipeline can be built around it.

data.title: The "editable children" behaviour sticks even after a scene instance is deleted and placed again
data.body:
Tested on Godot 2.1, Windows 10 64 bits

Repro steps:
1) Create a scene with child nodes
2) Instance it in another scene
3) Enable "Editable children"
4) Delete the whole instance
5) Instance it again: notice it still has editable children, even though it should be a new instance.
Instancing scenes resulting in different root name doesn't make their children editable. It doesn't happen if the editor is restarted between 4) and 5).

It's probably related to https://github.com/godotengine/godot/issues/6455, my guess is the "editable" nodes is not a state of the nodes themselves, but a separate list, and this list is not updated when the node is deleted from the tree.

data.title: [Editor] Mouse cursor locks up when right-clicking while using a scrolling number input field
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Crux Linux, Kernel 4.9.0rc2
Godot 12843167cacf3bacca32c29b7ea8b4426392bad0

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
When holding the left mouse button pressed to scroll through numbers in a scrolling number field and then clicking right, the mouse cursor locks up and disappears. Expected behavior would be the mouse cursor not locking up and re-appearing.

**Steps to reproduce:**
1: You need a scrolling number input field. You can create a Sprite3D which has input fields like that, for example the ones for Vframes and Hframes.
2: Left-click the field and hold the button while moving your cursor to change the number.
While still holding the left mouse button, perform a right-click.
3: The cursor stays invisible and is locked up. Keyboard input still works though.

data.title: Crash at starting project manager or editor
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Ubuntu 16.04, complied with 7751a93

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
I complied tool with **target=release_debug** on Ubuntu and run `./bin/godot.x11.opt.tools.64`
```
$ ./bin/godot.x11.opt.tools.64
WARNING: initialize: Error setting locale modifiers
   At: platform/x11/os_x11.cpp:120.
Segmentation fault (core dumped)
```
if **target=debug**, no crash

**Steps to reproduce:**
with PR #6802, crash at start
```
$ git checkout 7751a93
$ scons -j 4 platform=x11 bits=64 verbose=no target=release_debug
$ ./bin/godot.x11.opt.tools.64
```

with before PR #6802, no crash
```
$ git checkout d0d81a2
$ scons -j 4 platform=x11 bits=64 verbose=no target=release_debug
$ ./bin/godot.x11.opt.tools.64
```

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):

data.title: Add debug/logging macro(s) for togglable debug output in the Godot source
data.body:
Follow-up on https://github.com/godotengine/godot/pull/7079#issuecomment-259449908

Currently we have lots of `print_line` and `printf` calls in the source code, that are either active (and often noisy) or commented out.
It would be better to have a macro like `DEBUG_PRINT` for those debugging statements, that would only output the string passed as an argument when in debug mode (triggered by the `-d`, `-debug` command line arguments).

It might be worth discussing if we want several levels of verbosity too.

data.title: Path2D should generate AT LEAST a baked point for each original array point
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10
Godot 2.1
One of latest Godot Builds from GitHub https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/611a94e3a673a61b51746366366c698c66ef0195

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Path2D should generate AT LEAST a baked point for each original array point
Examples:
Using baking value at 50.
In orange there is the generated baked curve, in blue is the original array of points created in the editor:
**In Godot:**
![t2dcbby 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12376042/20165029/76f01d72-a6e8-11e6-8b3c-4276566ebd06.png)
Should generate instead something like this:
**Drawing of how the baked curves should be in Photoshop**
![eokjo0d 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12376042/20165173/cfb6551a-a6e9-11e6-9f60-62f0dd034203.png)

Now using a baking value longer than the whole path (example this path is +- 100 length so lets use 512)
**In Godot:**
![iofyjfy 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12376042/20165234/33ea3dc6-a6ea-11e6-998e-c3d8693f45aa.png)
Nothing is baked with values longer than path length
Instead should generate in this case:
**Drawing of how the baked curves should be in Photoshop**
![er3uote 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12376042/20165277/99d108b8-a6ea-11e6-9008-35778fe850e3.png)

Both issues are fixed with an algorithm baking always a point for each original point.
Some things to take in consideration or discuss with this change:

- Should the baking length for next baked point be reset at an original point?, Maybe make a Flag for this behavior, something like reset_baked_value_at_original_point?
Graphical example of reset vs don't reset in Photoshop:
![mh4qfdn 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12376042/20165551/0f125f8a-a6ed-11e6-9d6f-3bb7fdd62516.png)

- Add a flag to bake only the original points?. Aka disable baking and ignore curves 

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a Path2D
Add a curve and set the baking to a high value

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
A project drawing the baked curve in editor
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/s/poknngxj7z4yo37/path2d_tesselation.zip

data.title: Weird movement behavior with paths
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Windows 10
Godot 2.1
One of latest Godot Builds from GitHub https://github.com/godotengine/godot/commit/611a94e3a673a61b51746366366c698c66ef0195

**Issue description** (what happened, and what was expected):
Weird movement in a path with Cubic Interp off and baking at default value
I was expecting LINEAR movement
This is fixed with big baking values (example 512)

Here is a video of the issue:
https://gfycat.com/TinyTotalBarbet
Top Sprite is moving with Linear movement on x axis without using paths (`pos.x += speed * delta`)
Bot Sprite is a path using a line in the Curve2D moving the offset with the same formula from top, bot sprites should move at the same speed 

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a path and make a long line in the Curve 2d with two points (more than 512 pixel long)
Set the baking at default value (5) and disable Cubic Interp
Move the PathFollow2D with this formula:
```
func _fixed_process(delta):
	if(_follower != null && speed != 0.0):
		_follower.set_offset(_follower.get_offset() + speed * delta)
```

**Link to minimal example project** (optional but very welcome):
Here is a demo showcasing the issue:
https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/s/7pkt2rv9cgt3g73/path2d_speed_test.zip
With baking at default value (5) or < 512 produces the bug, baking at 512 fixes the issue
If the two sprites moves at same speed without taking account the baking value, the issue is fixed
Top Sprite is moving without path, Bot is moving using path.

data.title: Expose path 2d points array in editor
data.body:
I would like to edit the points from a path 2d manually without using code, for that could be useful to expose the non-baked Vector2Array. This is similar to polygon or collision polygon points behavior, the user could access to array directly from editor and edit values manually.

As a reference could be like this when the user try to edit the generated Curve2D Resource in path 2d:
![3em3w38 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/12376042/20160583/da2a02da-a6c6-11e6-8a71-1f38f83c2a89.png)
